stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.

Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.

stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

preGame:
Step right up, ladies, gentlemen, and entities of the void! It is a glorious, foggy evening here at The Old Fort, and you are listening to Nok the Corrupter bringing you the opening match of the Losers Bracket playoffs! The air is thick with the scent of ancient moss, damp stone, and the delicious anticipation of impending dental trauma! We are deep in the ruins of Kerlauger, where the 'Runeguard' usually play pretend among the standing stones, but tonight, there is no pretending! It is Game One of a Best of 3 series, and the stakes are higher than a Harpy's nest! Lose this series, and you are headed straight for the dumpster of history! Boy howdy, I can already feel the desperation in the air! 

On one side of the muddy field, we have the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres! Ringleader Kython has sent his finest troupe of chaos-makers to perform a different kind of show tonight! I caught Gagliano Tallbott earlier whispering a knock-knock joke to the leather troll head—let’s hope the ball has a better sense of humor than the 'heroes' of Eponore! Meanwhile, Milo Nelie was seen tracing sigils over his heart. Will it stop a spear? Only time and a lack of mercy will tell! This circus is looking to turn this ancient fort into a funhouse of pain, and I am here for every scream!

Defending their crumbling home turf are the Kerlauger Runeguard! These warriors of the White Ravens are looking more serious than a tax collector in a famine! I saw Johnna Beetner wandering the field earlier, picking up pebbles to add to her collection. Perhaps she thinks they'll provide better defense than Dame Terra Monteforte’s 'dirt magic'! And look at Shepperd Trefler over there, braiding his hair into those tight, battle-ready rows—he’s clearly ready to crack some skulls for the glory of the ruins! The fog is rolling in, the footing is uneven, and the atmosphere is electric! Who will take the first step toward the next round, and who will be left licking their wounds in the mud? Let's get to the action!
postGame:
What a magnificent display of organized mayhem we witnessed tonight under the thick veil of the Kerlauger fog! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres have taken a commanding 1-0 lead in this Best of 3 series, silencing the home crowd at The Old Fort with a 5-2 victory that was as flashy as a firework and twice as dangerous! From the very first whistle, it was clear that the Bizarres didn't come here to sight-see the ruins; they came to leave their mark on the Runeguard's faces! It was a whirlwind of colorful violence that would make even my boss, Lord Orzalon, crack a sinister smile!

The match ignited when Willa Lois snatched the ball right out of the gates, dancing through the fog like a phantom! The Runeguard tried to lock things down, but Lon Gabriell and Shepperd Trefler were swinging at shadows! The first real crack of bone came when Lon Gabriell finally connected, sending Milo Nelie to the sidelines with a nasty injury! But the Bizarres aren't just performers; they're fighters! Pompei Hephzipa immediately retaliated, putting Vivia Namara on the ground in a heap of armor and regret! It was a back-and-forth exchange of brutality that set the tone for the entire evening!

Then came the first highlight of the night! Bush Heiner, ignoring the unstable footing of the ancient ruins, wound up and let a shot fly from Center Field! The leather troll head soared through the misty air and found the basket perfectly! That’s 2 points for the circus crew, and the momentum shifted faster than a goblin's loyalty! The Runeguard tried to claw back, with Reginauld Cordell making a desperate run, but his wild pass ended up in the dirt. It was a chaotic scramble that saw Pompei Hephzipa intercepting a pass from Lon Gabriell, proving that these circus folk have hands like glue!

The injuries just kept piling up as the first half drew to a close! Demp Chet decided Vivia Namara hadn't had enough and sent her back to the healer’s tent with a thunderous tackle! Gurney Fadiman tried to answer back for the home team but his shot went wide, leaving the Runeguard frustrated as the halftime horn sounded. Healers Essa Pattie and Eal Caundra certainly earned their keep during the break, patching up the mangled remains of both squads so we could get right back to the beautiful carnage in the second half!

When play resumed, the Bizarres didn't miss a beat! Melesa Zelten, the man with the synchronized chant, found his rhythm and buried another long-range shoot right into the basket! Suddenly, it was 4-0, and the 'heroes' of the White Ravens were looking like they’d seen a ghost in these ruins! But give credit to Harilda Sigsmond—the Runeguard's captain showed some life! Despite the dense fog obscuring the goal, Sigsmond unleashed a spectacular shoot from Away Field that actually found its mark! The home fans finally had something to cheer about as the lead cut to 4-2!

But the Bizarres were not to be denied! The final minutes of the match were a symphony of violence that saw players falling like autumn leaves! Harilda Sigsmond took out Pompei Hephzipa, but Aggri Cookie immediately answered by sending Vivia Namara back to the dirt for a third time! I haven't seen this much medical activity since Sir Artorias tried to 'befriend' a hydra! Lorilee Aldred and Gurney Fadiman were doing their best to even the numbers, injuring Pompei and Quintessa Austine respectively, but the Bizarres' depth was simply too much to handle!

In the closing moments, the Bizarres put the final nail in the coffin! With the Runeguard defense in tatters, Aggri Cookie found an opening and charged straight into the end zone! No fancy shooting required here, folks—just a pure, authoritative dunk into the goal to secure the final point! The stadium fell silent, save for the cackling of the Bizarres as they celebrated their 5-2 triumph! It was a masterclass in combining athletic grace with the kind of tooth-rattling hits that make Trollball the greatest sport on any plane of existence!

Poor Colm and Dame Terra Monteforte must be shaking their heads at this performance! The Runeguard looked more like 'Run-away-guards' by the end of it! They were stumbling over the uneven footing of their own stadium while the Bizarres treated the ancient ruins like their personal playground! It just goes to show that fancy runes and legendary histories don't mean a lick when you've got a halberd-wielding madman like Aggri Cookie barreling down on you!

So, the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres walk away with the win and all the momentum! They are now just one victory away from advancing and keeping their championship dreams alive! The Kerlauger Runeguard, on the other hand, are standing on the precipice of elimination! They'll need more than pebbles and goat's milk toasts if they want to survive Game Two! They need to find some fire, or they'll be watching the rest of the playoffs from the bleachers with the rest of the losers!

What a night! What a match! I’m Nok the Corrupter, and I’ll be back to call the next bone-crunching installment of this series! Until then, keep your weapons sharp and your healers close! This is Tuesday Night Trollball, where the only thing better than a goal is a well-placed spiked gauntlet to the ribs! Goodnight, Osterra, and may your regeneration always be quick enough for the next play!
